page.title: 14THE FORFAR BY-PASS
page.content: THE FORFAR BY-PASS IS TO BE THE TRUNK ROAD (A94) THROUGH TAYSIDE AND WILL BE A DUAL CARRIAGEWAY WITH EACH LANE BEING{7.3m}WIDE AND HAVING A{4.5m CENTRAL RESERVE.EACH VERGE WILL BE{ {3.5m}WIDE AND THE SIDE SLOPES WILL BE AT A GRADIENT OF 3:1.THE TOTAL WIDTH OF THE CARRIAGEWAY WILL BE{26.1m}. THE ROAD SURFACE WILL BE DRAINED BY ROAD GULLIES, DESIGNED TO COPE WITH AN ANNUAL STORM AND THE DRAINS WILL BE MADE OF VITRIFIED CLAY AND CONCRETE ON PVC. AGRICULTURAL LAND HAS BEEN TAKEN BY COMPULSORY PURCHASE FOR THE SCHEME AND EXTENDS TO APPROXIMATELY{7.5}HECTARES. IT WILL ALSO BE NECESSARY TO DIVERT THE LEMNO WATER OVER A LENGTH OF{450m. { }THERE ARE SIX CONTRACTORS TENDERING FOR THE JOB WHICH WILL LAST ABOUT 2 YEARS AND WILL START IN JULY 1985.THE TOTAL ESTIMATED COST IS Â£7.5 MILLION.
